=== Test Plan ===

'''Use the test plan as a base line to guide your manual testing.'''

==== Login ====

* Open Gmail
** verify that the app opens, and that you are prompted for a user/password
* Login with your personal account
** verify that you reach the main inbox screen and are not redirected outside of the webapp to the browser
* Stop the app, and login with your professional account (@canonical.com if applicable)
** verify that the login process stays within the confine of the webapp and that you are not redirected either

==== User switching ====

Applicable if you have 2 user accounts

* Go to the drawer menu on the top left, and ues the drop down menu at the top to switch to another user
** verify that the whole process of login in as another use and switch to the other user mailbox all happens within the webapp, with no redirecting into the browser application
* Switch back to the first user account
** verify that you reach the first user inbox view

==== Reading emails ====

* Scroll down the main inbox view, and back up
* Use the drawer menu to switch to another tag/folder; switch back to your inbox
* Click the refresh button to check for new emails
* Open the last arrived email at the top of the inbox list; scroll down to read the whole message content
** verify that the rendering of the message is correct
** click on links to verify that the open in the browser
** click on a PDF attachment (open with PDFJsViewer which you need installed first)
* Search for emails, with the search field at the top of the inbox list

==== Composing emails ====

* Click on the "Write email" icon
* Enter 1 main recipient and CC yourself
** verify that auto-completion works
* Write down a sample text
** Note: pasting text is not supported currently
* Add an attachment
** verify that the content-hub chooser let's you complete the attachment process
* Send the email and verify the result in your own inbox

==== Misc ====

* Use one of the top header icons with Google+, Calendar and Web search links
** Verify the calendar link keeps you in the same webapp (note: this is a temporary behaviour)
** Verify that the G+ icon sends you to the Google+ application (you need to have installed the "Canonica" Google+ webapp first)
** Verify that other application links send you to the browser application
